title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement cubedsupport@meisebotanicgarden.. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Small typos grammatical errors documentation may edited directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. E.g. edit roxygen2 comment .R file R/, .Rd file man/.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: make substantial pull request, always file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s problem. ’ve found bug, create associated issue illustrate bug minimal reproducible example.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: recommend create Git branch pull request (PR). Look GitHub Actions build status making changes. README contain badges continuous integration services used package. require tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2. use testthat. Contributions test cases included easier accept. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md current development version header describing changes made followed GitHub username, links relevant issue(s)/PR(s).

title: Background
text: Extracted report Indicators Impact Alien Taxa, B3 project deliverable. 5.3. read full report visit (https://b-cubed.eu/library) negative impact alien species one leading causes biodiversity loss [1]. challenge appropriate management impact lack sufficient evidence-based indicators impact caused alien species satisfy Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable (FAIR) principles data [2]. growing information distributions (GBIF, 2025), standard assessments impact caused alien species across different native ecosystems become available [e.g., 3–6] ,room standard method infer impact alien species indicators combination occurrences impact assessment. terms policy, indicator allow prioritisation key species sites, tracking response controls, forecasting impact possible future scenarios [7]. Various indicators proposed used track invasions time (Vicente et al., 2022; Wilson et al., 2018). Indicators focussing occurrence alien species include cumulative number established alien species (Henriksen et al., 2024) relative abundance alien species [8,9]. indicators based species occurrence provide trends invasion generally, necessarily depict trend impact ecosystem. Also, capture variability magnitude impact caused alien species. occurrence-based indicator can advanced incorporating impact variability species account limitations. Red List Index (RLI) alien species impact indicator uses change extinction risk native species caused alien species evidence impact ecosystem [10–12]. RLI based IUCN Red List Threatened Species categorises species status range Least Concern Extinct. Changes Red List categories can attributed factors alien species. , changes can serve useful proxy gauging magnitude alien species’ impacts native biodiversity [12]. Although RLI reflects variation alien species affect native species, fully capture specific magnitude impacts mechanisms alien species exert impacts broader ecosystem. species’ impact magnitude mechanisms coupled alien species distribution can provide better representation alien species impact recipient ecosystem. Moreover, RLI evidence based classification relies heavily expert opinion, makes comparison across timescales difficult. Environmental Impact Classification Alien Taxa (EICAT), recently adopted IUCN, offers information impact alien species mechanisms thereof [13]. Alien species categorised Minimal Massive levels concern, depending magnitude impact reported native species [14,15]. Combining impact alien species occurrence can give representation alien species particular region [16]. combination data impacts occurrences proposed indicator impact invasions [9], standardised methodology achieve practice. Recent research seen significant practical developments address shortcoming. example, [7] used EICAT species distribution map impact Acacia species South Africa. authors transformed EICAT categories numerical values computed impact score site. Building approach, now derive species-specific impact values time produce refined impact indicators. , expand methods [7] [17] integrating open-source EICAT assessments species occurrence data, making impact indicators taxonomically, spatially, temporally explicit. part B3 project (https://b-cubed.eu/), developed workflow calculate impact indicator visualises impact alien species time across space. workflow embedded R package following standard software development guide [18]. workflow produces three main products include () species impact indicator, (ii) site impact indicator (iii) overall impact indicator.

title: Background
text: workflow uses Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF) occurrence data (https://www.gbif.org/). GBIF largest database biodiversity information adheres FAIR Data Principles widely used scientific purposes, demonstrating reliability. workflow uses occurrence cube - data format aggregates occurrences along spatial, taxonomical temporal scale - suitable modelling computational analysis. GBIF provides options spatial resolution aggregating occurrences, European Environmental Agency (EEA) Extended Quarter Degree Grid Cells (QDGC) commonly employed South African atlas projects. downloaded GBIF occurrence cube processed using b3gbi R package. ensures standardised input data analysis verifies data format correct. Alternatively, occurrence cube customised site resolution code can built GBIF occurrence data within workflow. correct sampling bias, computations convert multiple species occurrences site per year binary presence (1) absence (0) values.

title: Background
text: workflow uses EICAT impact assessments categorise impact alien species minimal concern (MC), minor (MN), moderate (MO), major (MR), massive (MV) based severity species’ negative impact caused native species recipient community. Specifically, species assigned MC - reduction performance individuals native species MN - performance individuals reduced, decrease native species population size MO - native species’ population reduces MR - impact led species’ local extinction naturally reversible MV - impact led naturally irreversible extirpation extinction. impacts also classified based 12 mechanisms described IUCN include competition, predation, hybridisation, transmission disease, parasitism, poisoning/toxicity, bio-fouling direct physical disturbance, grazing/herbivory/browsing, chemical impact ecosystem, physical impact ecosystem, structural impact ecosystem, indirect impact interactions species. Additional information location impact also reported. data collection process EICAT assessments involves several key steps. First, raw impact records alien species gathered established search protocol using scientific literature, databases, relevant sources. impacts categorised according EICAT criteria. assessment undergoes rigorous review EICAT Authority, comprising experts diverse taxonomic groups geographic regions, ensure accuracy consistency. validated, assessments published IUCN Global Invasive Species Database (GISD), making accessible scientists, conservation practitioners, policymakers prioritising management actions developing preventive mitigation measures (IUCN, 2020b). Currently, EICAT assessments GISD fully open FAIR, although efforts address underway (personal communication, P Genovesi). Available EICAT data can presently downloaded https://www.iucngisd.org/gisd/. species lacking published assessments, users can independently conduct assessments within workflow.

what: Transforming EICAT impact categories to numerical values
title: Background
text: EICAT categories semi-quantitative (ordinal) data need transformed numerical values enable computation. transformation depends assumptions relationship impact categories (e.g., linear) interpretation minimal concern (e.g., zero impact). transformation - MC = 0, MN = 1, MO = 2, MR = 3 MV = 4 assumes categories linear relationship minimal impact implies zero impact since impact found native species (e.g., Hagen & Kumschick 2018). - MC = 1, MN = 2, MO = 3, MR = 4 MV = 5 assumes linear relationship minimal concern implying concern even impact found native species’ individual (e.g., Jansen & Kumschick 2022). - MC = 0, MN = 10, MO = 100, MR = 1000 MV = 10000 assumes impact categories exponential relationship minimal concern equal zero impact (e.g., Rumlerová et al., 2016).

title: Background
text: Species often reported multiple impact categories specific different study locations mechanisms exert impact. example, Acacia dealbata categorised MR Drakensberg, South Africa structural impact MN Biobio region, Chile (see dataset Jansen & Kumschick 2022). get estimate likely impact category apply broadly, aggregate multiple impact scores per species one impact score per species. Aggregation methods include, overall maximum, sum across maximum mechanism overall mean. Additional statistics included future updates. - maximum: maximum method assigns species maximum impact across records species (Blackburn et al., 2014; IUCN, 2020a; Kumschick et al., 2024). best precautionary approaches. Also, assumption management highest impact can cover lower impact caused species can best low confidence multiple impacts species interest. However, maximum method can overestimate impact species especially highest impact requires specific rare conditions many lower impacts recorded. - sum across maximum mechanism: Assigns species summation maximum impact per mechanism (Nentwig et al., 2010). assumption species many mechanisms impact higher potential cause impact. - mean: Assigns species mean impact species impact. method computes expected impact species considering species impact without differentiating impacts (D’hondt et al., 2015). method adequate many impact records per species. Finally, compensate regions (spatial areas ranges occurrence data) many sites (grid cells covering region) higher overall impact value, divide impact value number sites occupied region.

title: Background
text: Multiple alien species can co-occur site. get information sites affected alien species (.e. site impact), aggregate different impacts per species site using one five methods proposed Boulesnane-Genguant et al. (submitted). methods precautionary, precautionary cumulative, mean, mean cumulative, cumulative depend combinations aggregation within species across species. - precautionary: method uses maximum method aggregate species’ impact compute maximum impact across species site. - precautionary cumulative: Uses maximum method aggregate species’ impact compute summation impacts site. precautionary cumulative method provides highest impact score possible species considers number co-occurring species site. - mean: Uses mean method aggregate species’ impact computes mean species site. mean provides expected impact within individual species across species site. - mean cumulative: Uses mean method aggregate species’ impact computes summation impact scores site. mean cumulative provides expected impact score within individual species adds co-occurring species’ impact scores site. - cumulative: Uses sum across maximum mechanism method aggregate species’ impact computes summation species’ impacts per site. cumulative method provides comprehensive view overall impact considering impact mechanisms multiple species.

title: Background
text: Furthermore, estimate impacts species study area, sum impact values sites year. Also, compensate regions many sites higher overall impact value, divide impact value number sites occupied region. \[I_i = \frac{\sum{S_i}}{N}\] - \(I_i\) impact score year \(\). - \(S_i\) sum risk map value, \(S=\{s_1,s_2,\dots,s_n\}\) \(s_n\) site score site \(n\) - \(N\) number sites occupied study years region.

what: Process GBIF data from the R environment
title: Prepare data
text: import GBIF data using read.csv(), readr::read_csv(), readxl::read_excel() based data set format. example GBIF occurrences data minimum required columns.decimalLatitude, decimalLongitude, species, speciesKey, coordinateUncertaintyInMeters year region study given shapefile study area character representing country study area . example : cube sim_cube object. example acacia taxa South Africa
code: southAfrica_sf #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 0 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 16.48333 ymin: -34.822 xmax: 32.89043 ymax: -22.13639 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>                         geometry #> 1 MULTIPOLYGON (((31.2975 -22... acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   first_year = 2010,   last_year = 2023 ) # View processed cube acacia_cube #>  #> Simulated data cube for calculating biodiversity indicators #>  #> Date Range: 2010 - 2023  #> Number of cells: 385  #> Grid reference system: custom  #> Coordinate range: #>      xmin      xmax      ymin      ymax  #>  16.60833  31.35833 -34.69700 -22.94701  #>  #> Total number of observations: 5663  #> Number of species represented: 28  #> Number of families represented: Data not present  #>  #> Kingdoms represented: Data not present  #>  #> First 10 rows of data (use n = to show more): #>  #> # A tibble: 5,663 × 8 #>    scientificName   taxonKey minCoordinateUncerta…¹  year cellCode xcoord ycoord #>    <chr>               <dbl>                  <dbl> <dbl> <chr>     <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                      8  2010 1376       30.4  -29.7 #>  2 Acacia saligna    2978552                      1  2010 206        18.4  -33.9 #>  3 Acacia implexa    2979232                      1  2010 206        18.4  -33.9 #>  4 Acacia pycnantha  2978604                      1  2010 206        18.4  -33.9 #>  5 Acacia cyclops    2980425                    122  2010 668        18.4  -32.2 #>  6 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                   1100  2010 1110       29.9  -30.7 #>  7 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                      1  2010 215        20.6  -33.9 #>  8 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                    110  2010 215        20.6  -33.9 #>  9 Acacia pycnantha  2978604                   1100  2010 143        19.1  -34.2 #> 10 Acacia saligna    2978552                      1  2011 206        18.4  -33.9 #> # ℹ 5,653 more rows #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​minCoordinateUncertaintyInMeters #> # ℹ 1 more variable: obs <dbl>

title: Prepare data
text: cube can generated downloading GBIF rgbif::occ_data()

title: Prepare data
text: impIndicator works cubes standard grid cell, , eea eqdgc processed b3gbi::process_cube(). example mammal_cube b3gbi package.
code: # Load GBIF data cube cube_name <- system.file("extdata", "denmark_mammals_cube_eqdgc.csv",                          package = "b3gbi")  # Prepare cube mammal_cube <- b3gbi::process_cube(cube_name, first_year = 2000)  # View cube mammal_cube #>  #> Processed data cube for calculating biodiversity indicators #>  #> Date Range: 2000 - 2024  #> Single-resolution cube with cell size 0.25degrees  #> Number of cells: 265  #> Grid reference system: eqdgc  #> Coordinate range: #>   xmin   xmax   ymin   ymax  #>  3.375 15.125 54.125 58.875  #>  #> Total number of observations: 191676  #> Number of species represented: 97  #> Number of families represented: 31  #>  #> Kingdoms represented: Animalia  #>  #> First 10 rows of data (use n = to show more): #>  #> # A tibble: 28,155 × 15 #>     year cellCode  kingdomKey kingdom  familyKey family  taxonKey scientificName #>    <dbl> <chr>          <dbl> <chr>        <dbl> <chr>      <dbl> <chr>          #>  1  2000 E006N56DB          1 Animalia      9680 Odoben…  5218819 Odobenus rosm… #>  2  2000 E008N54BA          1 Animalia      5310 Phocid…  2434793 Phoca vitulina #>  3  2000 E008N55AA          1 Animalia      5310 Phocid…  2434793 Phoca vitulina #>  4  2000 E008N55AB          1 Animalia      5307 Mustel…  2433753 Lutra lutra    #>  5  2000 E008N55AB          1 Animalia      5510 Muridae  7429082 Mus musculus   #>  6  2000 E008N55AC          1 Animalia      5307 Mustel…  2433753 Lutra lutra    #>  7  2000 E008N55AC          1 Animalia      5310 Phocid…  2434793 Phoca vitulina #>  8  2000 E008N55AC          1 Animalia      5310 Phocid…  2434806 Halichoerus g… #>  9  2000 E008N55AC          1 Animalia      9701 Canidae  5219243 Vulpes vulpes  #> 10  2000 E008N55AC          1 Animalia      9379 Lepori…  7952072 Lepus europae… #> # ℹ 28,145 more rows #> # ℹ 7 more variables: obs <dbl>, minCoordinateUncertaintyInMeters <dbl>, #> #   minTemporalUncertainty <dbl>, familyCount <dbl>, xcoord <dbl>, #> #   ycoord <dbl>, resolution <chr>

code: @Manual{,   title = {impIndicator: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa. Version 0.1.0},   author = {Mukhtar Muhammed Yahaya and Sabrina Kumschick and Sandra MacFadyen and Pietro Landi and Cang Hui},   year = {2025},   url = {https://b-cubed-eu.github.io/impIndicator/},   abstract = {Compute impact indicators of alien taxa using GBIF occurrence cube and EICAT assessment of alien species. Aggregates species impact of various scores due to mecahnism. Aggregates site impact of various scores due to species.},   keywords = {impact; alien species; biodiversity indicators; data cubes}, }

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: goal impIndicator allow users seamlessly calculate visualise impact alien taxa individual species given area. calculates visualises potential impact per site map. takes GBIF occurrence data EICAT assessment data. enables users choose various methods calculating impact indicators based different assumptions. impIndicator produces three main products can useful stated : overall impact indicator <compute_impact_indicator()> impact indicator offers nuanced representation trends biological invasions area (local, regional, global scales). tracking increase decrease ecological threats time, product provides insights dynamics alien species impacts, helping assess whether current management practices effective need adjustment. temporal analysis impact indicator enables targeted resource allocation, fostering proactive interventions mitigate biodiversity loss ecosystem degradation. site impact indicator <compute_impact_per_site()> site impact map serves visual analytical tool represent intensity biological invasions across different parts area. enabling spatial comparisons—provinces, states, conservation areas—, highlights hotspots areas risk invasion impact. spatial data useful prioritising management actions, coordinating restoration projects, fostering cross-regional collaboration address alien species impacts effectively. species impact indicator <compute_impact_per_species()> species impact produces trends individual alien species, enabling species-specific impact attributed invasions. data supports comparisons individual species’ impacts, revealing roles interactions within invaded area. species impact invaluable prioritising species-specific management efforts, informing control eradication strategies, advancing research alien species’ ecological roles adaptation patterns.

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: Install impIndicator R: can install development version GitHub :
code: install.packages("impIndicator", repos = c("https://b-cubed-eu.r-universe.dev", "https://cloud.r-project.org")) # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("b-cubed-eu/impIndicator")

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: demonstrate computation visualisation impact indicator biological invasions using impIndicator package: compute_impact_indicator() function compute impact indicators alien taxa, compute_impact_per_species() function compute impact indicators per species, compute_impact_per_site() function compute impact indicators per site. functions require (1) species occurrence cube processed b3gbi::process_cube() function within taxa_cube(), (2) Environmental Impact Classification Alien Taxa (EICAT) impact score species. Go vignette("Background", package = "impIndicator") read functions.
code: # Load packages library(impIndicator) #> Warning: package 'impIndicator' was built under R version 4.4.3  library(b3gbi)     # General biodiversity indicators for data cubes #> Warning: package 'b3gbi' was built under R version 4.4.3 library(ggplot2)   # Visualisation library(tidyr)     # Data wrangling

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF) occurrence data standardised species dataset documents presence absence species particular locations time points.
code: # Process cube from GBIF occurrence data in the R studio environment acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   first_year = 2010 )  acacia_cube #>  #> Simulated data cube for calculating biodiversity indicators #>  #> Date Range: 2010 - 2024  #> Number of cells: 415  #> Grid reference system: custom  #> Coordinate range: #>      xmin      xmax      ymin      ymax  #>  16.60833  31.60833 -34.69700 -22.94701  #>  #> Total number of observations: 6728  #> Number of species represented: 29  #> Number of families represented: Data not present  #>  #> Kingdoms represented: Data not present  #>  #> First 10 rows of data (use n = to show more): #>  #> # A tibble: 6,728 × 8 #>    scientificName   taxonKey minCoordinateUncerta…¹  year cellCode xcoord ycoord #>    <chr>               <dbl>                  <dbl> <dbl> <chr>     <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                      8  2010 1376       30.4  -29.7 #>  2 Acacia saligna    2978552                      1  2010 206        18.4  -33.9 #>  3 Acacia implexa    2979232                      1  2010 206        18.4  -33.9 #>  4 Acacia pycnantha  2978604                      1  2010 206        18.4  -33.9 #>  5 Acacia cyclops    2980425                    122  2010 668        18.4  -32.2 #>  6 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                   1100  2010 1110       29.9  -30.7 #>  7 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                      1  2010 215        20.6  -33.9 #>  8 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                    110  2010 215        20.6  -33.9 #>  9 Acacia pycnantha  2978604                   1100  2010 143        19.1  -34.2 #> 10 Acacia saligna    2978552                      1  2011 206        18.4  -33.9 #> # ℹ 6,718 more rows #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​minCoordinateUncertaintyInMeters #> # ℹ 1 more variable: obs <dbl>

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: Environmental Impact Classification Alien Taxa (EICAT) assessment data reported impact alien taxa based EICAT method International Union Conservation Nature (IUCN) standard. assessed alien taxa adequate data classified massive (MV), major (MR), moderate (MO), minor (MN), minimal concern (MC) depending severity impact caused recipient ecosystem. Additional information mechanisms location impact also recorded. example EICAT dataset :
code: # View EICAT data head(eicat_acacia, 10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    scientific_name   impact_category impact_mechanism                            #>    <chr>             <chr>           <chr>                                       #>  1 Acacia saligna    MC              (1) Competition                             #>  2 Acacia saligna    MC              (12) Indirect impacts through interaction … #>  3 Acacia saligna    MC              (1) Competition                             #>  4 Acacia saligna    MC              (1) Competition; (9) Chemical impact on th… #>  5 Acacia mearnsii   MC              (6) Poisoning/toxicity                      #>  6 Acacia longifolia MC              (9) Chemical impact on ecosystems           #>  7 Acacia dealbata   MC              (9) Chemical impact on ecosystems           #>  8 Acacia dealbata   MC              (9) Chemical impact on ecosystems           #>  9 Acacia saligna    MC              (9) Chemical impact on ecosystems           #> 10 Acacia dealbata   MC              (12) Indirect impacts through interaction …

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: impact risk map shows impact score site, multiple species can present. compute impact risk per site, aggregated scores across species site needed. site_impact() uses max, sum mean metrics aggregate impact scores across species proposed Boulesnane-Guengant et al., (preparation). combinations within species aggregation metrics species across species site leads five methods calculating impact indicator, namely, precautionary (precaut), precautionary cumulative (precaut_cum), mean, mean cumulative (mean_cum) cumulative (cum).
code: siteImpact <- compute_impact_per_site(   cube = acacia_cube,   impact_data = eicat_acacia,   method = "mean_cum" )  # Impact map # Visualise last four years for readability plot(x = siteImpact, region = southAfrica_sf, first_year = 2021)

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: compute impact indicator alien taxa, sum yearly impact scores site study region. correct sampling effort divide yearly impact scores number sites study region least single occurrence throughout whole year.
code: # Impact indicator impactIndicator <- compute_impact_indicator(   cube = acacia_cube,   impact_data = eicat_acacia,   method = "mean_cum" )  # Visualise impact indicator plot(impactIndicator)

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: compute impact indicator per species summing impact risk map per species correct sampling effort dividing \(N\).
code: # Impact indicator per species species_value <- compute_impact_per_species(   cube = acacia_cube,   impact_data = eicat_acacia,   method = "mean" )  # Visualise species impact plot(species_value)

title: Overall impact indicator — compute_impact_indicator
text: Combines occurrences cube impact data using given method (e.g., mean cumulative) compute impact indicator species given region

title: Overall impact indicator — compute_impact_indicator
code: compute_impact_indicator(   cube,   impact_data = NULL,   method = NULL,   trans = 1,   col_category = NULL,   col_species = NULL,   col_mechanism = NULL )

title: Overall impact indicator — compute_impact_indicator
text: cube data cube class sim_cube processed_cube b3gbi::process_cube(). impact_data dataframe species impact contains columns impact_category, scientific_name impact_mechanism. method method computing indicator. method used aggregation within across species site proposed Boulesnane-Genguant et al. (submitted). method can one "precaut": "precautionary" method assigns species maximum impact across records species compute maximum impact across species site "precaut_cum": "precautionary cumulative" method assigns species maximum impact across records species compute summation impacts site. precautionary cumulative method provides highest impact score possible species considers number co-occurring species site. "mean":"mean" method assigns species mean impact species impact computes mean species site. mean provides expected impact within individual species across species site. "mean_cum": "mean cumulative" assigns species mean impact species impact computes summation impact scores site. mean cumulative provides expected impact score within individual species adds co-occurring species’ impact scores site. "cum": "cumulative" assigns species summation maximum impact per mechanism computes summation species’ impacts per site. cumulative method provides comprehensive view overall impact considering impact mechanisms multiple species. trans Numeric: 1 (default), 2 3. method transformation convert EICAT categories c("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") numerical values: 1: converts categories c(0, 1, 2, 3, 4) 2: converts categories c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5) 3: converts categories c(1, 10, 100, 1000, 10000) col_category name column containing impact categories. first two letters categories must EICAT short names (e.g "MC - Minimal concern"). col_species name column containing species names. col_mechanism name column containing mechanisms impact.

title: Overall impact indicator — compute_impact_indicator
text: dataframe invasive alien impact trend (class impact_indicator)

title: Overall impact indicator — compute_impact_indicator
code: acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   res = 0.25,   first_year = 2010 ) impact_value <- compute_impact_indicator(   cube = acacia_cube,   impact_data = eicat_acacia,   method = "mean_cum",   trans = 1 )

title: Site impact indicator — compute_impact_per_site
text: cube data cube class sim_cube processed_cube b3gbi::process_cube(). impact_data dataframe species impact contains columns impact_category, scientific_name impact_mechanism. method method computing indicator. method used aggregation within across species site proposed Boulesnane-Genguant et al. (submitted). method can one "precaut": "precautionary" method assigns species maximum impact across records species compute maximum impact across species site "precaut_cum": "precautionary cumulative" method assigns species maximum impact across records species compute summation impacts site. precautionary cumulative method provides highest impact score possible species considers number co-occurring species site. "mean":"mean" method assigns species mean impact species impact computes mean species site. mean provides expected impact within individual species across species site. "mean_cum": "mean cumulative" assigns species mean impact species impact computes summation impact scores site. mean cumulative provides expected impact score within individual species adds co-occurring species’ impact scores site. "cum": "cumulative" assigns species summation maximum impact per mechanism computes summation species’ impacts per site. cumulative method provides comprehensive view overall impact considering impact mechanisms multiple species. trans Numeric: 1 (default), 2 3. method transformation convert EICAT categories c("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") numerical values: 1: converts categories c(0, 1, 2, 3, 4) 2: converts categories c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5) 3: converts categories c(1, 10, 100, 1000, 10000) col_category name column containing impact categories. first two letters categories must EICAT short names (e.g "MC - Minimal concern"). col_species name column containing species names. col_mechanism name column containing mechanisms impact.

title: Compute species impact indicator — compute_impact_per_species
text: Combines occurrences cube impact data using given method (e.g., mean) compute impact indicator per species.

title: Compute species impact indicator — compute_impact_per_species
code: compute_impact_per_species(   cube,   impact_data = NULL,   method = NULL,   trans = 1,   col_category = NULL,   col_species = NULL,   col_mechanism = NULL )

title: Compute species impact indicator — compute_impact_per_species
text: cube data cube class sim_cube processed_cube b3gbi::process_cube(). impact_data dataframe species impact contains columns impact_category, scientific_name impact_mechanism. method method computing indicator. method used aggregation within impact species. method can "max":maximum method assigns species maximum impact across records species. best precautionary approaches. Also, assumption management highest impact can cover lower impact caused species can best low confidence multiple impacts species interest. However, maximum method can overestimate impact species especially highest impact requires specific rare conditions many lower impacts recorded. "mean": assigns species mean impact species impact. method computes expected impact species considering species impact without differentiating impacts. method adequate many impact records per species. "max_mech": Assigns species summation maximum impact per mechanism. assumption species many mechanisms impact higher potential cause impact. trans Numeric: 1 (default), 2 3. method transformation convert EICAT categories c("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") numerical values: 1: converts categories c(0, 1, 2, 3, 4) 2: converts categories c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5) 3: converts categories c(1, 10, 100, 1000, 10000) col_category name column containing impact categories. first two letters categories must EICAT short names (e.g "MC - Minimal concern"). col_species name column containing species names. col_mechanism name column containing mechanisms impact.

title: Compute species impact indicator — compute_impact_per_species
text: dataframe impact indicator per species (class species_impact).

title: Compute species impact indicator — compute_impact_per_species
code: acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   res = 0.25,   first_year = 2010 )  speciesImpact <- compute_impact_per_species(   cube = acacia_cube,   impact_data = eicat_acacia,   method = "mean",   trans = 1 )

title: Impact categories — impact_cat
text: Aggregate species impact categories impact data. Species often reported multiple impact categories specific different study locations mechanisms exert impact. get estimate likely impact category apply broadly, function aggregate multiple impact scores per species one impact score per species.

title: Impact categories — impact_cat
code: impact_cat(   impact_data,   species_list,   trans = 1,   col_category = NULL,   col_species = NULL,   col_mechanism = NULL )

title: Impact categories — impact_cat
text: impact_data dataframe species impact contains columns impact_category, scientific_name impact_mechanism. species_list vector species' list aggregate impact categories. trans Numeric: 1 (default), 2 3. method transformation convert EICAT categories c("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") numerical values: 1: converts categories c(0, 1, 2, 3, 4) 2: converts categories c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5) 3: converts categories c(1, 10, 100, 1000, 10000) col_category name column containing impact categories. first two letters categories must EICAT short names (e.g "MC - Minimal concern"). col_species name column containing species names. col_mechanism name column containing mechanisms impact.

title: Impact categories — impact_cat
text: dataframe containing aggregated species impact. max - maximum impact species. mean - mean impact species. max_mech - sum maximum impact per categories species

title: Impact categories — impact_cat
code: # define species list species_list <- c(   "Acacia adunca",   "Acacia baileyana",   "Acacia binervata",   "Acacia crassiuscula",   "Acacia cultriformis",   "Acacia cyclops",   "Acacia dealbata",   "Acacia decurrens",   "Acacia elata" )  agg_impact <- impact_cat(   impact_data = eicat_acacia,   species_list = species_list,   trans = 1 )

title: Plot overall impact indicator — plot.impact_indicator
text: x dataframe impact indicator. Must class "impact_indicator" linewidth width size line. Default 2 colour colour line Default "red" title_lab Title plot. Default "Impact indicator" y_lab Label y-axis. Default "Impact score" x_lab Label x-axis. Default "Year" text_size size text plot. Default "14" ... Additional arguments passed geom_line

title: Build occurrences cube — taxa_cube
text: Prepare data cube calculate species impact . function taxa_cube can take scientific name taxa interest character GBIF occurrences data containing necessary columns. GBIF occurrences downloaded scientific names given.

title: Build occurrences cube — taxa_cube
code: taxa_cube(   taxa,   region,   limit = 500,   country = NULL,   res = 0.25,   first_year = NULL,   last_year = NULL )

title: Build occurrences cube — taxa_cube
text: taxa Character dataframe. character scientific name focal taxa dataframe GBIF occurrences data must contain columns "decimalLatitude", "decimalLongitude", "species", "speciesKey", "coordinateUncertaintyInMeters", "dateIdentified", "year". region sf character. shapefile region study character represent name country limit Number records return GBIF download. Default set 500 country Two-letter country code (ISO-3166-1) country GBIF occurrences data downloaded. res resolution grid cells used. Default 0.25 first_year year occurrence start last_year year occurrence end

title: Build occurrences cube — taxa_cube
text: data cube sim_cubes

title: Build occurrences cube — taxa_cube
code: acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   first_year = 2010 )
